revised_title: Lipid Composition and Biochemistry of Endemic Fauna in Lake Baikal
tldr: The study examines the biochemical composition and detailed lipid content of the endemic fauna in Lake Baikal, Siberia. The research reveals high levels of long-chain co3 polyunsaturated fatty acids in glyceride-esters, the presence of large amounts of triglyceride in certain species, and a simple sterol composition dominated by cholesterol. These findings contribute to understanding the lipid chemistry of freshwater organisms and the evolution of the unique Baikalian fauna.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Freshwater Biology
